questions.question: The postman …………………. be here soon.
questions.description: We use should to indicate possibility.

questions.question: …………………………. we invite Mark?
questions.description: We use should to ask for a suggestion.

questions.question: She ………………………… be told.
questions.description: We use should to express necessity.

questions.question: People …………………….. drive more carefully.
questions.description: We use should to express necessity.

questions.question: I …………………………. come tomorrow if I got time.
questions.description: In the second conditional, we use a past tense in the if-clause and would + infinitive in the main clause.

questions.question: I ………………………………. be grateful for an early reply.
questions.description: Both would and should can be used with the first person pronouns with little difference of meaning.

questions.question: ……………………………. you like some help?
questions.description: We use would in polite offers and requests.

questions.question: ……………………………. I go and see the police?
I knew that I ………………………… talk to her, but it seemed too difficult.
I …………………………. have sent the money this morning, but I forgot.
questions.description: Should have is often used to talk about past events that did not happen.

questions.question: You ……………………………. have shouted at her – it really upset her.
questions.description: Should not have is often used to talk about unwanted things that happened.
